Title: Hijacking of GABAA Receptors by Mutant Glycine Receptors
Abstract: © 2019 Elsevier LtdStartle disease results from mutations in genes encoding inhibitory GlyR α1 and β subunits or the presynaptic glycine transporter GlyT2. However, the most effective therapies are benzodiazepines that potentiate inhibitory GABAAR function. A recent publication by Zou et al. adds further complexity by suggesting that dominant GlyR α1 mutants assemble into pre- and extrasynaptic GABAARs.
